questionTitle: Which of the following resource(s) represents the bottleneck in the current system that limits the system’s performance?
questionExplanation: Depending upon a server’s configuration, any resource can have a bottleneck removed, and the resource ceiling then passes onto another resource.

questionOption1: Load testing software is a large product category with software and hardware products
questionOption3: Load testing is useful in testing the performance of only Web servers
questionExplanation: Load testing is useful in testing the performance of not only Web servers, but also application servers, database servers, network throughput, load balancing servers, and applications that rely on client-side processing.

questionTitle: Which of the following application can replay requests to Web servers?
questionExplanation: This tool runs the requests from a single client, which can be a resource limitation of its own.

questionTitle: Which of the following is often a bottleneck in Web servers?
questionExplanation: Network I/O (D) reaches its maximum 100-percent utilization at about 50 percent of the tested load, and this factor is the current system resource ceiling.

questionOption1: Most load balancers allow you to weight the requests going to a specific server with the goal of serving more requests to less powerful systems and fewer requests to more powerful systems
questionOption2: Most load balancers allow you to weight the requests going to a specific server with the goal of serving more requests to more powerful systems and fewer requests to less powerful systems
questionOption3: Most load balancers allow you to weight the requests going to a specific server with the goal of serving fewer requests to more powerful systems and more requests to less powerful systems
questionExplanation: When you have multiple virtual servers that are part of a server farm and have a load balancer in front of them, you can use your load balancer to test your servers’ resource ceilings.

questionExplanation: Web sites prefer to scale out using many low-powered servers instead of scaling up with fewer but more powerful servers.

questionTitle: Which of the following resource has following graph structure for web servers?

questionTitle: What does WnsP represent in the following formula?</br> WT = Σ(WSnP WSnV)
questionOption3: sum over all the Web servers
questionExplanation: In this equation, WSnP represents the workload of your physical server(s) and WSnV is the workload of the virtual servers (cloud-based server instances) of your infrastructure.

questionTitle: A master/slave MySQL replication architectural scheme is used for ________ database applications.
